snippet: Financial penalties will multiply for demonstrators in Russia who have seemed re-energized after President Vladmir V. Putin’s inauguration last month.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin signs into law a measure that will impose heavy fines on people who organize or take part in unsanctioned demonstrations, giving Russian authorities powerful leverage to clamp down on the large antigovernment street protests that began six months ago and seem to have re-energized after Putin's inauguration.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry and Andrew Roth contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Financial penalties will multiply for demonstrators in Russia who have seemed re-energized after President Vladmir V. Putin’s inauguration last month.

headline.seo: Russian Law Will Impose Heavy Fines for Protesters
headline.main: New Russian Law Assesses Heavy Fines on Protesters
headline.print_headline: New Russian Law Assesses Heavy Fines on Protesters
